danaus

Class Tile

  • java.lang.Object
    • danaus.Tile
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.Comparable<Tile>
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    Cliff, Forest, Land, Water

    public abstract class Tile
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.Comparable<Tile>
    An instance represents a map tile. A tile has information to identify it, information essential to a simulation, and information for a GUI.

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      boolean flyable
      True iff the tile can be flown to.
      static java.lang.String IMAGE_EXT
      Image extension.
      static java.lang.String OBSTACLES_DIR
      The root directory of all obstacle images.
      static java.lang.String TILES_DIR
      The root directory of all tile images.
      long turnEntered
      The most recent turn a butterfly entered.

    • Field Detail

      • flyable

        public final boolean flyable
        True iff the tile can be flown to.

      • TILES_DIR

        public static java.lang.String TILES_DIR
        The root directory of all tile images.

      • OBSTACLES_DIR

        public static java.lang.String OBSTACLES_DIR
        The root directory of all obstacle images.

      • IMAGE_EXT

        public static java.lang.String IMAGE_EXT
        Image extension.

      • turnEntered

        public long turnEntered
        The most recent turn a butterfly entered. This can be used to update the path trail of a butterfly in the GUI. -1 indicates that the tile has not yet been entered.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Tile

        public Tile(java.lang.String name,
    java.lang.String skin,
    boolean flyable,
    int slowDown,
    int powerCost,
    TileState tileState,
    java.lang.String tileFilename)
        Constructor: a tile instance.
        Its name is name. e.g. "forest".
        Its skin is skin (e.g. "snow").
        It can be entered only if flyable is true.
        slowDown is slow-down number -- @see danaus.AbstractButterfly#fly(Direction, Speed).
        powerCost is the power cost -- @see danaus.Map#updateCosts().
        tileState is the dynamic state information of the tile.
        tileFilename is the name of the image file for the tile.
        A turn has not yet been entered for this tile.

    • Method Detail

      • copy

        public static boolean copy(Tile to,
           Tile from)
        Copies one tile into another. This method is designed to allow subclasses of a tile be converted between one another. For example, a cliff can be converted to land. Thus, only non-tile specific information is copied.

      • toString

        public java.lang.String toString()
        Returns a string representation of the object.
        Overrides:
        toString in class java.lang.Object

      • toStringMap

        public java.lang.String toStringMap()
        Returns a string representation of the object that can be used to print an ascii representation of the map. A tile's ascii map string reflects whether the tile has a butterfly or flowers.
        Returns:
        An ascii map string representation of the object.

      • toStringTile

        public abstract java.lang.String toStringTile()
        Returns a tile's unique printable character. Each tile has a unique printable character to print in an ascii map.
        Returns:
        A tile's unique printable character.

      • getType

        public abstract TileType getType()
        Return tile type

      • equals

        public boolean equals(java.lang.Object obj)
        Return true iff obj is a Tile and this object and obj are at the same location.
        Tiles on different maps in the same location are equal, even if they appear very different. This is acceptable because tiles from different maps should not be interacting. All comparisons are performed within the scope of a map.
        Overrides:
        equals in class java.lang.Object

      • hashCode

        public int hashCode()
        Returns a hash code value for the object. This method is supported for the benefit of hashtables such as those provided by java.util.Hashtable.
        Overrides:
        hashCode in class java.lang.Object
        Returns:
        a hash code value for this object.

      • compareTo

        public int compareTo(Tile t)
        Return a negative integer, zero, or a positive integer depending on whether this tile's location is less than equal to, or greater than the location of obj.
        Specified by:
        compareTo in interface java.lang.Comparable<Tile>
